subject: Leadership
title: Building a Feedback Culture
description: A 60-second lesson on Building a Feedback Culture.

hook.text: A company runs an annual survey. Scores are low. Leaders promise change. Nothing happens. Next year, nobody responds.

buildup.text: Feedback culture means continuous, honest exchange flows in all directions: up, down, and across the organization.

discovery.text: Netflix's culture memo: 'We are honest even when it's uncomfortable.' Their radical candor fuels innovation speed.

twist.text: Feedback culture can't be mandated. It must be modeled. When leaders seek and act on feedback, everyone follows suit.

climax.text: Start small: weekly one-on-ones with one real question, 'What's one thing I could do better?' Act on answers visibly.

punchline.text: Culture isn't what you preach. It's what you tolerate and practice.

quiz.question: How do leaders build a feedback culture?
options: Modeling it by seeking and acting on feedback
